sentences.zh: 趙氏之先，與秦共祖。

translations.literal: Zhao clan's forebears, together with Qin shared ancestor.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao clan's forebears shared an ancestor with Qin.

sentences.zh: 至中衍，為帝大戊御。

translations.literal: Reached Zhong Yan, was Emperor Da Wu's charioteer.
translations.idiomatic: Reaching Zhong Yan, he was Emperor Da Wu's charioteer.

sentences.zh: 其後世蜚廉有子二人，而命其一子曰惡來，事紂，為周所殺，其後為秦。

translations.literal: His later generations Feilian had sons two, and named his one son said Elai, served Zhou, was by Zhou killed, his descendants became Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In his later generations, Feilian had two sons, and named one of them Elai. Elai served King Zhou and was killed by the Zhou. His descendants became Qin.

sentences.zh: 惡來弟曰季勝，其後為趙。

translations.literal: Elai's younger brother named Jisheng, his descendants became Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Elai's younger brother was named Jisheng. His descendants became Zhao.

sentences.zh: 季勝生孟增。

translations.literal: Jisheng begat Mengzeng.
translations.idiomatic: Jisheng begat Mengzeng.

sentences.zh: 孟增幸於周成王，是為宅皋狼。

translations.literal: Mengzeng favored by Zhou Cheng Wang, this was Zhaigaolang.
translations.idiomatic: Mengzeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou. This was Zhaigaolang.

sentences.zh: 皋狼生衡父，衡父生造父。

translations.literal: Gaolang begat Hengfu, Hengfu begat Zaofu.
translations.idiomatic: Gaolang begat Hengfu. Hengfu begat Zaofu.

sentences.zh: 造父幸於周繆王。

translations.literal: Zaofu favored by Zhou Mu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zaofu was favored by King Mu of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 造父取驥之乘匹，與桃林盜驪、驊騮、綠耳，獻之繆王。

translations.literal: Zaofu took Ji's chariot team, together with Taolin's stolen Lilu, Hualiu, Lver, presented them to Mu Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zaofu took Ji's chariot team, together with Taolin's Daoli, Hualiu, and Lver, and presented the horses to King Mu.

sentences.zh: 繆王使造父御，西巡狩，見西王母，樂之忘歸。

translations.literal: Mu Wang made Zaofu drive, west toured, saw Xi Wang Mu, enjoyed it forgot return.
translations.idiomatic: King Mu made Zaofu drive. He toured to the west, saw the Queen Mother of the West, and enjoyed it so much that he forgot to return.

sentences.zh: 而徐偃王反，繆王日馳千里馬，攻徐偃王，大破之。

translations.literal: While Xu Yan Wang rebelled, Mu Wang daily galloped thousand li horses, attacked Xu Yan Wang, greatly defeated him.
translations.idiomatic: While King Yan of Xu rebelled, King Mu daily galloped the thousand-li horses, attacked King Yan of Xu, and greatly defeated him.

sentences.zh: 乃賜造父以趙城，由此為趙氏。

translations.literal: Then granted Zaofu Zhao city, from this became Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: He then granted Zaofu the city of Zhao. From this they became the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 自造父已下六世至奄父，曰公仲，周宣王時伐戎，為御。

translations.literal: From Zaofu below six generations to Yanfu, called Gongzhong, Zhou Xuan Wang time attacked Rong, was charioteer.
translations.idiomatic: From Zaofu down six generations to Yanfu, called Gongzhong. In King Xuan of Zhou's time, when attacking the Rong, he was charioteer.

sentences.zh: 及千畝戰，奄父脫宣王。

translations.literal: When Qianmu battle, Yanfu rescued Xuan Wang.
translations.idiomatic: At the battle of Qianmu, Yanfu rescued King Xuan.

sentences.zh: 奄父生叔帶。

translations.literal: Yanfu begat Shudai.
translations.idiomatic: Yanfu begat Shudai.

sentences.zh: 叔帶之時，周幽王無道，去周如晉，事晉文侯，始建趙氏于晉國。

translations.literal: Shudai's time, Zhou You Wang without way, left Zhou went to Jin, served Jin Wen Hou, began building Zhao clan in Jin state.
translations.idiomatic: In Shudai's time, King You of Zhou was without the way. He left Zhou and went to Jin, served Marquis Wen of Jin, and began building the Zhao clan in the state of Jin.

sentences.zh: 自叔帶以下，趙宗益興，五世而（生）［至］趙夙。

translations.literal: From Shudai below, Zhao lineage increasingly flourished, five generations then reached Zhao Shu.
translations.idiomatic: From Shudai down, the Zhao lineage increasingly flourished. After five generations, they reached Zhao Shu.

sentences.zh: 趙夙，晉獻公之十六年伐霍、魏、耿，而趙夙為將伐霍。

translations.literal: Zhao Shu, Jin Xian Gong's sixteenth year attacked Huo, Wei, Geng, and Zhao Shu was general attacked Huo.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shu. In Duke Xian of Jin's sixteenth year, he attacked Huo, Wei, and Geng. Zhao Shu was the general who attacked Huo.

sentences.zh: 霍公求奔齊。

translations.literal: Huo Gong Qiu fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qiu of Huo fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉大旱，卜之，曰「霍太山為祟」。

translations.literal: Jin great drought, divined it, said 'Huo Taishan is causing the trouble.'
translations.idiomatic: Jin had a great drought. They divined it and said: 'Mount Huo Taishan is causing the trouble.'

sentences.zh: 使趙夙召霍君於齊，復之，以奉霍太山之祀，晉復穰。

translations.literal: Made Zhao Shu summon Huo lord from Qi, restored him, to offer Huo Taishan's sacrifices, Jin again prosperous.
translations.idiomatic: They made Zhao Shu summon the Huo lord from Qi and restore him, to offer Mount Huo Taishan's sacrifices. Jin again became prosperous.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公賜趙夙耿。

translations.literal: Jin Xian Gong granted Zhao Shu Geng.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian of Jin granted Zhao Shu Geng.

sentences.zh: 夙生共孟，當魯閔公之元年也。

translations.literal: Shu begat Gong Meng, was in Lu Min Gong's first year.
translations.idiomatic: Shu begat Gong Meng. This was in Duke Min of Lu's first year.

sentences.zh: 共孟生趙衰，字子餘。

translations.literal: Gong Meng begat Zhao Shuai, styled Ziyv.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Meng begat Zhao Shuai, styled Ziyu.

sentences.zh: 趙衰卜事晉獻公及諸公子，莫吉；

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai divined serving Jin Xian Gong and various princes, none auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuai divined about serving Duke Xian of Jin and the various princes. None were auspicious.

sentences.zh: 卜事公子重耳，吉，即事重耳。

translations.literal: Divined serving Prince Chong'er, auspicious, then served Chong'er.
translations.idiomatic: He divined about serving Prince Chong'er. It was auspicious, so he then served Chong'er.

sentences.zh: 重耳以驪姬之亂亡奔翟，趙衰從。

translations.literal: Chong'er because of Li Ji's disorder fled to Di, Zhao Shuai followed.
translations.idiomatic: Chong'er, because of Li Ji's disorder, fled to the Di. Zhao Shuai followed.

sentences.zh: 翟伐廧咎如，得二女，翟以其少女妻重耳，長女妻趙衰而生盾。

translations.literal: Di attacked Xia Jiuru, obtained two women, Di with their younger daughter married Chong'er, elder daughter married Zhao Shuai and gave birth to Dun.
translations.idiomatic: The Di attacked Xia Jiuru and obtained two women. The Di married their younger daughter to Chong'er, and their elder daughter to Zhao Shuai, who gave birth to Dun.

sentences.zh: 初，重耳在晉時，趙衰妻亦生趙同、趙括、趙嬰齊。

translations.literal: Initially, when Chong'er was in Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Yingqi.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Chong'er was in the state of Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Yingqi.

sentences.zh: 趙衰從重耳出亡，凡十九年，得反國。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai followed Chong'er went into exile, altogether nineteen years, got to return to country.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuai followed Chong'er into exile. Altogether it was nineteen years before they got to return to the country.

sentences.zh: 重耳為晉文公，趙衰為原大夫，居原，任國政。

translations.literal: Chong'er became Jin Wen Gong, Zhao Shuai became Yuan grand master, resided in Yuan, took charge of state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Chong'er became Duke Wen of Jin. Zhao Shuai became the grand master of Yuan, resided in Yuan, and took charge of state affairs.

sentences.zh: 文公所以反國及霸，多趙衰計策，語在晉事中。

translations.literal: Wen Gong's return to country and hegemony, mostly Zhao Shuai's strategies, speech in Jin matters middle.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen's return to the country and his hegemony were mostly due to Zhao Shuai's strategies. This is discussed in the Jin matters.

sentences.zh: 趙衰既反晉，晉之妻固要迎翟妻，而以其子盾為適嗣，晉妻三子皆下事之。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai having returned to Jin, Jin's wife strongly demanded to welcome Di wife, and made her son Dun the proper heir, Jin wife's three sons all served below him.
translations.idiomatic: After Zhao Shuai had returned to Jin, his Jin wife strongly demanded to welcome the Di wife, and made her son Dun the proper heir. The Jin wife's three sons all served below him.

sentences.zh: 晉襄公之六年，而趙衰卒，謚為成季。

translations.literal: Jin Xiang Gong's sixth year, and Zhao Shuai died, posthumous name Cheng Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year of Duke Xiang of Jin, Zhao Shuai died. His posthumous name was Cheng Ji.

sentences.zh: 趙盾代成季任國政二年而晉襄公卒，太子夷皋年少。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun replaced Cheng Ji took charge of state affairs two years and Jin Xiang Gong died, Crown Prince Yi Gao young.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun replaced Cheng Ji and took charge of state affairs. After the two years, Duke Xiang of Jin died. Crown Prince Yi Gao was young.

sentences.zh: 盾為國多難，欲立襄公弟雍。

translations.literal: Dun for country's many difficulties, wished to establish Xiang Gong's younger brother Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Dun, because of the country's many difficulties, wished to establish Duke Xiang's younger brother Yong.

sentences.zh: 雍時在秦，使使迎之。

translations.literal: Yong at that time in Qin, sent envoy welcomed him.
translations.idiomatic: Yong was at that time in Qin. They sent an envoy to welcome him.

sentences.zh: 太子母日夜啼泣，頓首謂趙盾曰：「先君何罪，釋其適子而更求君？」

translations.literal: Crown Prince's mother day and night wept and wailed, kowtowed said to Zhao Dun: 'Former lord what crime, abandon his proper son and seek another lord?'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince's mother wept and wailed day and night. She kowtowed and said to Zhao Dun: 'What crime did the former lord commit, that you abandon his proper son and seek another lord?'

sentences.zh: 趙盾患之，恐其宗與大夫襲誅之，乃遂立太子，是為靈公，發兵距所迎襄公弟於秦者。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun worried about it, feared his clan and grand masters would suddenly execute him, then established the crown prince, this was Ling Gong, sent troops to block those welcoming Xiang Gong's younger brother from Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun worried about it and feared that his clan and the grand masters would suddenly execute him. He then established the crown prince. This was Duke Ling. He sent troops to block those welcoming Duke Xiang's younger brother from Qin.

sentences.zh: 靈公既立，趙盾益專國政。

translations.literal: Ling Gong having been established, Zhao Dun increasingly monopolized state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Ling had been established, Zhao Dun increasingly monopolized state affairs.

sentences.zh: 靈公立十四年，益驕。

translations.literal: Ling Gong established fourteen years, increasingly arrogant.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling was established for fourteen years and became increasingly arrogant.

sentences.zh: 趙盾驟諫，靈公弗聽。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun repeatedly admonished, Ling Gong did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun repeatedly admonished him. Duke Ling did not listen.

sentences.zh: 及食熊蹯，胹不熟，殺宰人，持其尸出，趙盾見之。

translations.literal: When eating bear's paw, stew not cooked, killed the butcher, carried his corpse out, Zhao Dun saw it.
translations.idiomatic: When eating bear's paw, the stew was not cooked. He killed the butcher, carried his corpse out, and Zhao Dun saw it.

sentences.zh: 靈公由此懼，欲殺盾。

translations.literal: Ling Gong from this feared, wished to kill Dun.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling feared from this and wished to kill Dun.

sentences.zh: 盾素仁愛人，嘗所食桑下餓人反捍救盾，盾以得亡。

translations.literal: Dun usually benevolent loved people, once the hungry person under mulberry tree he fed returned protected saved Dun, Dun thereby got to escape.
translations.idiomatic: Dun was usually benevolent and loved people. Once, the hungry person under the mulberry tree whom he had fed returned and protected and saved Dun. Dun thereby got to escape.

sentences.zh: 未出境，而趙穿弒靈公而立襄公弟黑臀，是為成公。

translations.literal: Not yet out of borders, and Zhao Chuan assassinated Ling Gong and established Xiang Gong's younger brother Heitun, this was Cheng Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Before he had left the borders, Zhao Chuan assassinated Duke Ling and established Duke Xiang's younger brother Heitun. This was Duke Cheng.

sentences.zh: 趙盾復反，任國政。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun again returned, took charge of state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun again returned and took charge of state affairs.

sentences.zh: 君子譏盾「為正卿，亡不出境，反不討賊」，故太史書曰「趙盾弒其君」。

translations.literal: Gentleman criticized Dun 'as chief minister, exile not out of borders, return not punish traitor', therefore grand scribe wrote said 'Zhao Dun assassinated his lord'.
translations.idiomatic: The gentlemen criticized Dun: 'As chief minister, in exile he did not leave the borders. On return, he did not punish the traitor.' Therefore the grand scribe wrote: 'Zhao Dun assassinated his lord.'

sentences.zh: 晉景公時而趙盾卒，謚為宣孟，子朔嗣。

translations.literal: Jin Jing Gong time and Zhao Dun died, posthumous name Xuan Meng, son Shuo succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: In the time of Duke Jing of Jin, Zhao Dun died. His posthumous name was Xuan Meng. His son Shuo succeeded.

sentences.zh: 趙朔，晉景公之三年，朔為晉將下軍救鄭，與楚莊王戰河上。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuo, Jin Jing Gong's third year, Shuo was Jin's lower army general saved Zheng, with Chu Zhuang Wang battled on Yellow River.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo. In Duke Jing of Jin's third year, Shuo was Jin's lower army general and saved Zheng. He battled with King Zhuang of Chu on the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 朔娶晉成公姊為夫人。

translations.literal: Shuo married Jin Cheng Gong's elder sister as wife.
translations.idiomatic: Shuo married Duke Cheng of Jin's elder sister as his wife.

sentences.zh: 晉景公之三年，大夫屠岸賈欲誅趙氏。

translations.literal: Jin Jing Gong's third year, grand master Tu An Jia wished to execute Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Jing of Jin's third year, grand master Tu An Jia wished to execute the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 初，趙盾在時，夢見叔帶持要而哭，甚悲；

translations.literal: Initially, when Zhao Dun was alive, dreamed saw Shudai held waist and cried, very sad.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Zhao Dun was alive, he had a dream in which he saw Shudai holding his waist and crying, very sad.

sentences.zh: 已而笑，拊手且歌。

translations.literal: Then laughed, clapped hands and sang.
translations.idiomatic: Then he laughed, clapped his hands, and sang.

sentences.zh: 盾卜之，兆絕而後好。

translations.literal: Dun divined it, omen broken then afterwards good.
translations.idiomatic: Dun divined it. The omen was broken, then afterwards it was good.

sentences.zh: 趙史援占之，曰：「此夢甚惡，非君之身，乃君之子，然亦君之咎。

translations.literal: Zhao scribe Yuan interpreted it, said: 'This dream very bad, not lord's body, rather lord's son, yet also lord's fault.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao scribe Yuan interpreted it, saying: 'This dream is very bad. It is not the lord's body, but rather the lord's son. Yet it is also the lord's fault.

sentences.zh: 至孫，趙將世益衰。」

translations.literal: Reach grandson, Zhao will generation increasingly decline.'
translations.idiomatic: Reaching the grandson, Zhao will decline generation after generation.'

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈者，始有寵於靈公，及至於景公而賈為司寇，將作難，乃治靈公之賊以致趙盾，遍告諸將曰：「盾雖不知，猶為賊首。

translations.literal: Tu An Jia, initially had favor with Ling Gong, and reached Jing Gong and Jia was judicial minister, about to make disturbance, then investigated Ling Gong's assassin to implicate Zhao Dun, widely told various generals said: 'Dun though did not know, still was traitor head.
translations.idiomatic: Tu An Jia initially had favor with Duke Ling. When he reached Duke Jing, Jia was judicial minister. About to make a disturbance, he then investigated Duke Ling's assassin to implicate Zhao Dun. He widely told the various generals, saying: 'Dun, though he did not know, was still the traitor's head.

sentences.zh: 以臣弒君，子孫在朝，何以懲罪？

translations.literal: With minister assassinated lord, descendants in court, how to punish crime?
translations.idiomatic: With a minister assassinating the lord, and descendants in the court, how are we to punish the crime?

sentences.zh: 請誅之。」

translations.literal: Request execute them.'
translations.idiomatic: I request to execute them.'

sentences.zh: 韓厥曰：「靈公遇賊，趙盾在外，吾先君以為無罪，故不誅。

translations.literal: Han Que said: 'Ling Gong encountered traitor, Zhao Dun outside, my former lord considered no crime, therefore did not execute.
translations.idiomatic: Han Que said: 'Duke Ling encountered the traitor. Zhao Dun was outside. Our former lord considered him without crime, therefore did not execute him.

sentences.zh: 今諸君將誅其後，是非先君之意而今妄誅。

translations.literal: Now various lords about to execute his descendants, this not former lord's intention and now recklessly execute.
translations.idiomatic: Now the various lords are about to execute his descendants. This is not the former lord's intention, and now you recklessly execute them.

sentences.zh: 妄誅謂之亂。

translations.literal: Reckless execution called disorder.
translations.idiomatic: Reckless execution is called disorder.

sentences.zh: 臣有大事而君不聞，是無君也。」

translations.literal: Minister has great matter and lord not hear, this is without lord also.'
translations.idiomatic: When a minister has a great matter and the lord does not hear of it, this is to have no lord.'

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈不聽。

translations.literal: Tu An Jia did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Tu An Jia did not listen.

sentences.zh: 韓厥告趙朔趣亡。

translations.literal: Han Que told Zhao Shuo hasten flee.
translations.idiomatic: Han Que told Zhao Shuo to hasten and flee.

sentences.zh: 朔不肯，曰：「子必不絕趙祀，朔死不恨。」

translations.literal: Shuo not willing, said: 'You must not cut off Zhao sacrifices, Shuo die without regret.'
translations.idiomatic: Shuo was not willing. He said: 'You must not cut off the Zhao sacrifices. If Shuo dies, I will have no regret.'

sentences.zh: 韓厥許諾，稱疾不出。

translations.literal: Han Que promised, claimed illness did not go out.
translations.idiomatic: Han Que promised. He claimed illness and did not go out.

sentences.zh: 賈不請而擅與諸將攻趙氏於下宮，殺趙朔、趙同、趙括、趙嬰齊，皆滅其族。

translations.literal: Jia not request and arbitrarily with various generals attacked Zhao clan at lower palace, killed Zhao Shuo, Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Yingqi, all extinguished their clans.
translations.idiomatic: Jia did not request permission and arbitrarily, together with the various generals, attacked the Zhao clan at the lower palace. They killed Zhao Shuo, Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, and Zhao Yingqi, and extinguished all their clans.

sentences.zh: 趙朔妻成公姊，有遺腹，走公宮匿。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuo's wife Cheng Gong's elder sister, had posthumous child, fled ducal palace hid.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo's wife was Duke Cheng's elder sister. She had a posthumous child and fled to the ducal palace to hide.

sentences.zh: 趙朔客曰公孫杵臼，杵臼謂朔友人程嬰曰：「胡不死？」

translations.literal: Zhao Shuo's guest called Gongsun Chujiu, Chujiu said to Shuo's friend Cheng Ying: 'Why not die?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuo's guest was called Gongsun Chujiu. Chujiu said to Cheng Ying, a friend of Shuo's: 'Why do you not die?'

sentences.zh: 程嬰曰：「朔之婦有遺腹，若幸而男，吾奉之；

translations.literal: Cheng Ying said: 'Shuo's wife has posthumous child, if fortunately male, I will support him;
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Ying said: 'Shuo's wife has a posthumous child. If it is fortunately a male, I will support him.

sentences.zh: 即女也，吾徐死耳。」

translations.literal: If female also, I slowly die only.'
translations.idiomatic: If it is a female, I will slowly die, that is all.'

sentences.zh: 居無何，而朔婦免身，生男。

translations.literal: Resided not long, and Shuo's wife gave birth, bore male.
translations.idiomatic: Not long after, Shuo's wife gave birth and bore a male child.

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈聞之，索於宮中。

translations.literal: Tu An Jia heard it, searched in palace.
translations.idiomatic: Tu An Jia heard of it and searched in the palace.

sentences.zh: 夫人置兒叱罅祝曰：「趙宗滅乎，若號；

translations.literal: Lady placed child rebuked crevice priest said: 'Zhao lineage extinguished huh, if cry;
translations.idiomatic: The lady placed the child, rebuked the crevice, and prayed, saying: 'If the Zhao lineage is extinguished, then cry.

sentences.zh: 即不滅，若無聲。」

translations.literal: If not extinguished, if no sound.'
translations.idiomatic: If it is not extinguished, then make no sound.'

sentences.zh: 及索，兒竟無聲。

translations.literal: When searched, child ultimately no sound.
translations.idiomatic: When they searched, the child ultimately made no sound.

sentences.zh: 已脫，程嬰謂公孫杵臼曰：「今一索不得，後必且復索之，柰何？」

translations.literal: Already escaped, Cheng Ying said to Gongsun Chujiu: 'Now one search not obtained, later must moreover again search it, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: After they had escaped, Cheng Ying said to Gongsun Chujiu: 'Now the first search did not obtain it. Later they must again search for it. What are we to do?'

sentences.zh: 公孫杵臼曰：「立孤與死孰難？」

translations.literal: Gongsun Chujiu said: 'Establish orphan with die which difficult?'
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Chujiu said: 'Which is more difficult: establishing the orphan or dying?'

sentences.zh: 程嬰曰：「死易，立孤難耳。」

translations.literal: Cheng Ying said: 'Die easy, establish orphan difficult only.'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Ying said: 'Dying is easy. Establishing the orphan is difficult.'

sentences.zh: 公孫杵臼曰：「趙氏先君遇子厚，子彊為其難者，吾為其易者，請先死。」

translations.literal: Gongsun Chujiu said: 'Zhao clan former lord treated you generously, you strong do its difficult ones, I do its easy ones, request first die.'
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Chujiu said: 'The Zhao clan's former lord treated you generously. You be strong and do the difficult task. I will do the easy one. I request to die first.'

sentences.zh: 乃二人謀取他人嬰兒負之，衣以文葆，匿山中。

translations.literal: Then two people planned took other person's infant carried it, clothed with patterned quilt, hid mountain middle.
translations.idiomatic: Then the two men planned to take another person's infant, carry it, clothe it with a patterned quilt, and hide it in the mountains.

sentences.zh: 程嬰出，謬謂諸將軍曰：「嬰不肖，不能立趙孤。

translations.literal: Cheng Ying went out, falsely said to various generals: 'Ying unworthy, cannot establish Zhao orphan.

translations.literal: You saw me, I what do?'
translations.idiomatic: You saw me. What am I to do?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「帝令主君射熊與羆，皆死。」

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Emperor commanded master lord shoot bear and pi, all died.'
translations.idiomatic: The one who blocked the road said: 'The Emperor commanded the master lord to shoot a bear and a pi. Both died.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「是，且何也？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'This, moreover what huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'This is so. Moreover, what does it mean?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「晉國且有大難，主君首之。

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Jin state moreover has great difficulty, master lord heads it.
translations.idiomatic: The one who blocked the road said: 'Jin state will moreover have a great difficulty. The master lord will head it.

sentences.zh: 帝令主君滅二卿，夫熊與羆皆其祖也。」

translations.literal: Emperor commanded master lord extinguish two ministers, indeed bear and pi all their ancestors also.'
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor commanded the master lord to extinguish two ministers. Indeed, the bear and the pi are all their ancestors.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「帝賜我二笥皆有副，何也？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Emperor granted me two si all had deputy, what huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'The Emperor granted me two bamboo boxes, and both had duplicates. What does this mean?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「主君之子將克二國於翟，皆子姓也。」

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Master lord's son will conquer two countries in Di, all Zi surname also.'
translations.idiomatic: The one who blocked the road said: 'The master lord's son will conquer two countries in Di. Both are of the Zi surname.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「吾見兒在帝側，帝屬我一翟犬，曰『及而子之長以賜之』。

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'I saw child at Emperor side, Emperor entrusted me one Di dog, said 'when your son's grown with grant him'.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'I saw a child at the Emperor's side. The Emperor entrusted me with one Di dog and said: 'When your son is grown, grant it to him.'

sentences.zh: 夫兒何謂以賜翟犬？」

translations.literal: Indeed child what called with grant Di dog?'
translations.idiomatic: What does the child mean by granting the Di dog?'

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「兒，主君之子也。

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Child, master lord's son also.
translations.idiomatic: The one who blocked the road said: 'The child is the master lord's son.

sentences.zh: 翟犬者，代之先也。

translations.literal: Di dog ones, Dai's ancestors also.
translations.idiomatic: The Di dog represents Dai's ancestors.

sentences.zh: 主君之子且必有代。

translations.literal: Master lord's son moreover must have Dai.
translations.idiomatic: The master lord's son will moreover certainly have Dai.

sentences.zh: 及主君之後嗣，且有革政而胡服，并二國於翟。」

translations.literal: Reach master lord's later successors, moreover will have change governance and barbarian clothing, merge two countries in Di.'
translations.idiomatic: Reaching the master lord's later successors, they will moreover have a change in governance and barbarian clothing, and merge two countries in Di.'

sentences.zh: 簡子問其姓而延之以官。

translations.literal: Jian Zi asked his surname and invited him with office.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi asked his surname and invited him with an office.

sentences.zh: 當道者曰：「臣野人，致帝命耳。」

translations.literal: Blocked road one said: 'Minister rustic person, convey Emperor command only.'
translations.idiomatic: The one who blocked the road said: 'I am a rustic person, only conveying the Emperor's command.'

sentences.zh: 遂不見。

translations.literal: Then not seen.
translations.idiomatic: Then he was not seen.

sentences.zh: 簡子書藏之府。

translations.literal: Jian Zi wrote hid it treasury.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi wrote it down and hid it in the treasury.

sentences.zh: 異日，姑布子卿見簡子，簡子遍召諸子相之。

translations.literal: Different day, Gu Bu Zi Qing saw Jian Zi, Jian Zi universally summoned various sons examine their physiognomy.
translations.idiomatic: On a different day, Gu Bu Zi Qing saw Jian Zi. Jian Zi universally summoned his various sons to examine their physiognomy.

sentences.zh: 子卿曰：「無為將軍者。」

translations.literal: Zi Qing said: 'None are general material.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Qing said: 'None are general material.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「趙氏其滅乎？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Zhao clan perhaps extinguish huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'Will the Zhao clan perhaps be extinguished?'

sentences.zh: 子卿曰：「吾嘗見一子於路，殆君之子也。」

translations.literal: Zi Qing said: 'I once saw one son on road, perhaps lord's son also.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Qing said: 'I once saw one son on the road. Perhaps he is the lord's son.'

sentences.zh: 簡子召子毋卹。

translations.literal: Jian Zi summoned Zi Wu Xu.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi summoned Zi Wu Xu.

sentences.zh: 毋卹至，則子卿起曰：「此真將軍矣！」

translations.literal: Wu Xu arrived, then Zi Qing rose said: 'This truly general already!'
translations.idiomatic: When Wu Xu arrived, Zi Qing rose and said: 'This is truly a general!'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「此其母賤，翟婢也，奚道貴哉？」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'This his mother base, Di slave also, how way noble huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'His mother is base, a Di slave. How can he be noble?'

sentences.zh: 子卿曰：「天所授，雖賤必貴。」

translations.literal: Zi Qing said: 'Heaven bestowed, though base must noble.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Qing said: 'Heaven has bestowed it. Though he is base, he must be noble.'

sentences.zh: 自是之後，簡子盡召諸子與語，毋卹最賢。

translations.literal: From this after, Jian Zi completely summoned various sons and spoke with them, Wu Xu most worthy.
translations.idiomatic: From this time after, Jian Zi completely summoned his various sons and spoke with them. Wu Xu was the most worthy.

sentences.zh: 簡子乃告諸子曰：「吾藏寶符於常山上，先得者賞。」

translations.literal: Jian Zi then told various sons said: 'I hide treasure talisman on Chang Shan top, first obtainer reward.'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi then told his various sons, saying: 'I have hidden a treasure talisman on top of Chang Shan. The first to obtain it will be rewarded.'

sentences.zh: 諸子馳之常山上，求，無所得。

translations.literal: Various sons galloped to Chang Shan top, sought, nothing obtained.
translations.idiomatic: The various sons galloped to the top of Chang Shan and sought it, but obtained nothing.

sentences.zh: 毋卹還，曰：「已得符矣。」

translations.literal: Wu Xu returned, said: 'Already obtained talisman already.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu returned and said: 'I have already obtained the talisman.'

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「奏之。」

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Present it.'
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'Present it.'

sentences.zh: 毋卹曰：「從常山上臨代，代可取也。」

translations.literal: Wu Xu said: 'From Chang Shan top overlook Dai, Dai can take also.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu said: 'From the top of Chang Shan, one can overlook Dai. Dai can be taken.'

sentences.zh: 簡子於是知毋卹果賢，乃廢太子伯魯，而以毋卹為太子。

translations.literal: Jian Zi thereupon knew Wu Xu indeed worthy, then abolished crown prince Bo Lu, and with Wu Xu as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi thereupon knew that Wu Xu was indeed worthy. Then he abolished Crown Prince Bo Lu and made Wu Xu the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 後二年，晉定公之十四年，范、中行作亂。

translations.literal: Later two years, Jin Ding Gong's fourteenth year, Fan, Zhong Xing made rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Two years later, in the fourteenth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Fan and Zhong Xing made a rebellion.

sentences.zh: 明年春，簡子謂邯鄲大夫午曰：「歸我衛士五百家，吾將置之晉陽。」

translations.literal: Next year spring, Jian Zi told Han Dan grand master Wu said: 'Return me Wei soldiers five hundred households, I will place them Jin Yang.'
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the next year, Jian Zi told Handan's grand master Wu, saying: 'Return to me the five hundred households of Wei soldiers. I will place them in Jin Yang.'

sentences.zh: 午許諾，歸而其父兄不聽，倍言。

translations.literal: Wu promised, returned and his father elder brothers not listen, doubled words.
translations.idiomatic: Wu promised. When he returned, his father and elder brothers did not listen and went back on their word.

sentences.zh: 趙鞅捕午，囚之晉陽。

translations.literal: Zhao Yang captured Wu, imprisoned him Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang captured Wu and imprisoned him in Jin Yang.

sentences.zh: 乃告邯鄲人曰：「我私有誅午也，諸君欲誰立？」

translations.literal: Then told Han Dan people said: 'I privately have executed Wu also, various lords wish who establish?'
translations.idiomatic: Then he told the Handan people, saying: 'I have privately executed Wu. Whom do the various lords wish to establish?'

sentences.zh: 遂殺午。

translations.literal: Then killed Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Then he killed Wu.

sentences.zh: 趙稷、涉賓以邯鄲反。

translations.literal: Zhao Ji, She Bin with Han Dan rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ji and She Bin rebelled with Handan.

sentences.zh: 晉君使籍秦圍邯鄲。

translations.literal: Jin lord sent Ji Qin surround Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: The lord of Jin sent Ji Qin to surround Handan.

sentences.zh: 荀寅、范吉射與午善，不肯助秦而謀作亂，董安于知之。

translations.literal: Xun Yin, Fan Ji She with Wu friendly, not willing assist Qin and planned make rebellion, Dong An Yu knew it.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Yin and Fan Ji She were friendly with Wu. They were not willing to assist Qin and planned to make rebellion. Dong An Yu knew of it.

sentences.zh: 十月，范、中行氏伐趙鞅，鞅奔晉陽，晉人圍之。

translations.literal: Tenth month, Fan, Zhong Xing clan attacked Zhao Yang, Yang fled Jin Yang, Jin people surrounded him.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, the Fan and Zhong Xing clans attacked Zhao Yang. Yang fled to Jin Yang, and the Jin people surrounded him.

sentences.zh: 范吉射、荀寅仇人魏襄等謀逐荀寅，以梁嬰父代之；

translations.literal: Fan Ji She, Xun Yin enemy Wei Xiang etc. planned expel Xun Yin, with Liang Ying Fu replace him;
translations.idiomatic: Fan Ji She, Xun Yin's enemy Wei Xiang, and the others planned to expel Xun Yin and replace him with Liang Ying Fu.

sentences.zh: 逐吉射，以范皋繹代之。

translations.literal: Expelled Ji She, with Fan Gao Xi replace him.
translations.idiomatic: They expelled Ji She and replaced him with Fan Gao Xi.

sentences.zh: 荀櫟言於晉侯曰：「君命大臣，始亂者死。

translations.literal: Xun Li spoke to Jin Marquis said: 'Lord commands ministers, start rebellion ones die.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Li spoke to the Marquis of Jin, saying: 'The lord commands the ministers. Those who start rebellion die.

sentences.zh: 今三臣始亂而獨逐鞅，用刑不均，請皆逐之。」

translations.literal: Now three ministers started rebellion but alone expel Yang, use punishment not equal, please all expel them.'
translations.idiomatic: Now three ministers started rebellion, but you alone expel Yang. The use of punishment is not equal. I request to expel them all.'

sentences.zh: 十一月，荀櫟、韓不佞、魏哆奉公命以伐范、中行氏，不克。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Xun Li, Han Bu Ning, Wei Duo received duke command to attack Fan, Zhong Xing clan, not conquer.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Xun Li, Han Bu Ning, and Wei Duo received the duke's command to attack the Fan and Zhong Xing clans. They did not conquer them.

sentences.zh: 范、中行氏反伐公，公擊之，范、中行敗走。

translations.literal: Fan, Zhong Xing clan counter attacked duke, duke struck them, Fan, Zhong Xing defeated fled.
translations.idiomatic: The Fan and Zhong Xing clans counterattacked the duke. The duke struck them, and Fan and Zhong Xing were defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 丁未，二子奔朝歌。

translations.literal: Ding Wei, two sons fled Zhao Ge.
translations.idiomatic: On Ding Wei, the two sons fled to Zhao Ge.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏以趙氏為請。

translations.literal: Han, Wei with Zhao clan as request.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei made a request on behalf of the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 十二月辛未，趙鞅入絳，盟于公宮。

translations.literal: Twelfth month Xin Wei, Zhao Yang entered Jiang, allied at duke palace.
translations.idiomatic: On Xin Wei of the twelfth month, Zhao Yang entered Jiang and made an alliance at the duke's palace.

sentences.zh: 其明年，知伯文子謂趙鞅曰：「范、中行雖信為亂，安于發之，是安于與謀也。

translations.literal: Its next year, Zhi Bo Wen Zi told Zhao Yang said: 'Fan, Zhong Xing though truly made rebellion, An Yu revealed it, this is An Yu with planned also.
translations.idiomatic: In the next year, Zhi Bo Wen Zi told Zhao Yang, saying: 'Though Fan and Zhong Xing truly made rebellion, An Yu revealed it. This means An Yu was also involved in the planning.

sentences.zh: 晉國有法，始亂者死。

translations.literal: Jin state has law, start rebellion ones die.
translations.idiomatic: Jin state has a law: those who start rebellion die.

sentences.zh: 夫二子已伏罪而安于獨在。」

translations.literal: Indeed two sons already submitted to punishment but An Yu alone remains.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the two sons have already submitted to punishment, but An Yu alone remains.'

sentences.zh: 趙鞅患之。

translations.literal: Zhao Yang worried it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang was worried about it.

sentences.zh: 安于曰：「臣死，趙氏定，晉國寧，吾死晚矣。」

translations.literal: An Yu said: 'Minister dies, Zhao clan settles, Jin state pacifies, my death late already.'
translations.idiomatic: An Yu said: 'If the minister dies, the Zhao clan will be settled and Jin state will be pacified. My death comes late.'

sentences.zh: 遂自殺。

translations.literal: Then committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: Then he committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 趙氏以告知伯，然後趙氏寧。

translations.literal: Zhao clan with told Zhi Bo, then Zhao clan pacified.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhao clan told Zhi Bo of it. Then the Zhao clan was pacified.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞趙簡子不請晉君而執邯鄲午，保晉陽，故書春秋曰「趙鞅以晉陽畔」。

translations.literal: Kong Zi heard Zhao Jian Zi not requested Jin lord but executed Han Dan Wu, guarded Jin Yang, therefore wrote Chun Qiu said 'Zhao Yang with Jin Yang rebelled'.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius heard that Zhao Jian Zi did not request the lord of Jin but executed Handan Wu and guarded Jin Yang. Therefore he wrote in the Spring and Autumn Annals: 'Zhao Yang rebelled with Jin Yang.'

sentences.zh: 趙簡子有臣曰周舍，好直諫。

translations.literal: Zhao Jian Zi had minister called Zhou She, liked direct remonstrance.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Jian Zi had a minister called Zhou She, who liked direct remonstrance.

sentences.zh: 周舍死，簡子每聽朝，常不悅，大夫請罪。

translations.literal: Zhou She died, Jian Zi every listened court, often not pleased, grand masters requested punishment.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhou She died, Jian Zi, whenever he listened to court, was often not pleased. The grand masters requested punishment.

sentences.zh: 簡子曰：「大夫無罪。

translations.literal: Jian Zi said: 'Grand masters no crime.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi said: 'The grand masters have no crime.

sentences.zh: 吾聞千羊之皮不如一狐之腋。

translations.literal: I heard thousand sheep's skins not equal one fox's armpit.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that a thousand sheep's skins are not equal to one fox's armpit.

sentences.zh: 諸大夫朝，徒聞唯唯，不聞周捨之鄂鄂，是以憂也。」

translations.literal: Various grand masters court, only heard wei wei, not heard Zhou She 's e e, this is why worried also.'
translations.idiomatic: When the various grand masters are at court, I only hear yes-yes. I do not hear Zhou She's forthright remonstrance. This is why I am worried.'

sentences.zh: 簡子由此能附趙邑而懷晉人。

translations.literal: Jian Zi from this could attach Zhao cities and embrace Jin people.
translations.idiomatic: From this time, Jian Zi was able to attach the Zhao cities and embrace the Jin people.

sentences.zh: 晉定公十八年，趙簡子圍范、中行于朝歌，中行文子奔邯鄲。

translations.literal: Jin Ding Gong eighteenth year, Zhao Jian Zi besieged Fan, Zhong Xing at Zhao Ge, Zhong Xing Wen Zi fled Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Zhao Jian Zi besieged Fan and Zhong Xing at Zhao Ge. Zhong Xing Wen Zi fled to Handan.

sentences.zh: 明年，衛靈公卒。

translations.literal: Next year, Wei Ling Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the next year, Duke Ling of Wei died.

sentences.zh: 簡子與陽虎送衛太子蒯聵于衛，衛不內，居戚。

translations.literal: Jian Zi with Yang Hu sent Wei crown prince Kuai Kui to Wei, Wei not admitted, resided Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi, together with Yang Hu, sent Wei's crown prince Kuai Kui to Wei. Wei did not admit him, and he resided at the place called Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉定公二十一年，簡子拔邯鄲，中行文子奔柏人。

translations.literal: Jin Ding Gong twenty-first year, Jian Zi captured Han Dan, Zhong Xing Wen Zi fled Bo Ren.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year of Duke Ding of Jin, Jian Zi captured Handan. Zhong Xing Wen Zi fled to Bo Ren.

sentences.zh: 簡子又圍柏人，中行文子、范昭子遂奔齊。

translations.literal: Jian Zi again besieged Bo Ren, Zhong Xing Wen Zi, Fan Zhao Zi then fled Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jian Zi again besieged Bo Ren. Zhong Xing Wen Zi and Fan Zhao Zi then fled to the state of Qi.

sentences.zh: 趙竟有邯鄲、柏人。

translations.literal: Zhao finally had Han Dan, Bo Ren.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao finally had Handan and Bo Ren.

sentences.zh: 范、中行餘邑入于晉。

translations.literal: Fan, Zhong Xing remaining cities entered Jin.
translations.idiomatic: The remaining cities of Fan and Zhong Xing entered Jin.

sentences.zh: 趙名晉卿，實專晉權，奉邑侔於諸侯。

translations.literal: Zhao nominally Jin minister, actually monopolized Jin power, fief cities equal to feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao was nominally a Jin minister, but actually monopolized Jin's power. His fief cities were equal to those of the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 晉定公三十年，定公與吳王夫差爭長於黃池，趙簡子從晉定公，卒長吳。

translations.literal: Jin Ding Gong thirtieth year, Ding Gong with Wu King Fu Chai contended precedence at Huang Chi, Zhao Jian Zi followed Jin Ding Gong, finally preceded Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year of Duke Ding of Jin, Duke Ding contended for precedence with King Fu Chai of Wu at Huang Chi. Zhao Jian Zi followed Duke Ding of Jin, but finally Wu preceded.

sentences.zh: 定公三十七年卒，而簡子除三年之喪，期而已。

translations.literal: Ding Gong thirty-seventh year died, and Jian Zi removed three years' mourning, one year only.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ding died in his thirty-seventh year. Jian Zi removed the three years' mourning and made it one year only.

sentences.zh: 是歲，越王句踐滅吳。

translations.literal: This year, Yue King Gou Jian extinguished Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, King Gou Jian of Yue extinguished Wu.

sentences.zh: 晉出公十一年，知伯伐鄭。

translations.literal: Jin Chu Gong eleventh year, Zhi Bo attacked Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year of Duke Chu of Jin, Zhi Bo attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 趙簡子疾，使太子毋卹將而圍鄭。

translations.literal: Zhao Jian Zi ill, sent crown prince Wu Xu led and besieged Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Jian Zi was ill. He sent Crown Prince Wu Xu to lead and besiege Zheng.

sentences.zh: 知伯醉，以酒灌擊毋卹。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo drunk, with wine poured struck Wu Xu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo was drunk. With wine he poured and struck Wu Xu.

sentences.zh: 毋卹群臣請死之。

translations.literal: Wu Xu's various ministers requested to die for him.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu's various ministers requested to die for him.

sentences.zh: 毋卹曰：「君所以置毋卹，為能忍。」

translations.literal: Wu Xu said: 'Lord so placed Wu Xu, for able to endure.'
translations.idiomatic: Wu Xu said: 'The reason the lord placed Wu Xu is that he is able to endure.'

sentences.zh: 然亦慍知伯。

translations.literal: Yet also resented Zhi Bo.
translations.idiomatic: Yet he also resented Zhi Bo.

sentences.zh: 知伯歸，因謂簡子，使廢毋卹，簡子不聽。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo returned, therefore told Jian Zi, made abolish Wu Xu, Jian Zi not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo returned and therefore told Jian Zi to abolish Wu Xu. Jian Zi did not listen to the request.

sentences.zh: 毋卹由此怨知伯。

translations.literal: Wu Xu from this resented Zhi Bo.
translations.idiomatic: From this time, Wu Xu resented Zhi Bo.

sentences.zh: 晉出公十七年，簡子卒，太子毋卹代立，是為襄子。

translations.literal: Jin Chu Gong seventeenth year, Jian Zi died, crown prince Wu Xu succeeded stood, this was Xiang Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year of Duke Chu of Jin, Jian Zi died. Crown Prince Wu Xu succeeded and stood. This was Xiang Zi.

sentences.zh: 趙襄子元年，越圍吳。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiang Zi first year, Yue besieged Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Zhao Xiang Zi, Yue besieged Wu.

sentences.zh: 襄子降喪食，使楚隆問吳王。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi lowered mourning food, sent Chu Long inquired Wu King.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi reduced the mourning food and sent Chu Long to inquire of the King of Wu.

sentences.zh: 襄子姊前為代王夫人。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi sister previously was Dai King wife.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi's elder sister was previously the wife of the King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 簡子既葬，未除服，北登夏屋，請代王。

translations.literal: Jian Zi already buried, not yet removed mourning, north ascended Xia Wu, invited Dai King.
translations.idiomatic: After Jian Zi was buried, before the mourning was removed, he went north and ascended Xia Wu. He invited the King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 使廚人操銅枓以食代王及從者，行斟，陰令宰人各以枓擊殺代王及從官，遂興兵平代地。

translations.literal: Sent cook grasped bronze dagger to feed Dai King and followers, when pouring wine, secretly commanded butchers each with dagger struck killed Dai King and following officials, then raised troops pacified Dai territory.
translations.idiomatic: He sent a cook to grasp a bronze ladle to feed the King of Dai and his followers. When pouring wine, he secretly commanded the butchers each to strike and kill the King of Dai and the following officials with the ladle. Then he raised troops and pacified the territory of Dai.

sentences.zh: 其姊聞之，泣而呼天，摩笄自殺。

translations.literal: His sister heard it, wept and called heaven, rubbed hairpin committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: His sister heard of it, wept and called to heaven, rubbed her hairpin, and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 代人憐之，所死地名之為摩笄之山。

translations.literal: Dai people pitied her, place died named it Mo Ji mountain.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Dai pitied her. They named the place where she died Mo Ji Mountain.

sentences.zh: 遂以代封伯魯子周為代成君。

translations.literal: Then with Dai enfeoffed Bo Lu son Zhou as Dai Cheng Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Then he enfeoffed Bo Lu's son Zhou with Dai as Dai Cheng Jun.

sentences.zh: 伯魯者，襄子兄，故太子。

translations.literal: Bo Lu ones, Xiang Zi elder brother, former crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Bo Lu was Xiang Zi's elder brother, the former crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子蚤死，故封其子。

translations.literal: Crown prince early died, therefore enfeoffed his son.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince died early. Therefore he enfeoffed his son.

sentences.zh: 襄子立四年，知伯與趙、韓、魏盡分其范、中行故地。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi established four years, Zhi Bo with Zhao, Han, Wei completely divided their Fan, Zhong Xing former territories.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year after Xiang Zi was established, Zhi Bo, together with Zhao, Han, and Wei, completely divided the former territories of Fan and Zhong Xing.

sentences.zh: 晉出公怒，告齊、魯，欲以伐四卿。

translations.literal: Jin Chu Gong angry, told Qi, Lu, wished to attack four ministers.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu of Jin was angry. He informed Qi and Lu, wishing to attack the four ministers.

sentences.zh: 四卿恐，遂共攻出公。

translations.literal: Four ministers feared, then together attacked Chu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The four ministers were afraid, so they together attacked Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 出公奔齊，道死。

translations.literal: Chu Gong fled Qi, on road died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu fled to Qi, but died on the road.

sentences.zh: 知伯乃立昭公曾孫驕，是為晉懿公。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo then established Zhao Gong great-grandson Jiao, this was Jin Yi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo then established Jiao, the great-grandson of Duke Zhao, as Duke Yi of Jin.

sentences.zh: 知伯益驕。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo increasingly arrogant.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo became increasingly arrogant.

sentences.zh: 請地韓、魏，韓、魏與之。

translations.literal: Requested territory Han, Wei, Han, Wei gave it.
translations.idiomatic: He requested territory from Han and Wei, and Han and Wei gave it to him.

sentences.zh: 請地趙，趙不與，以其圍鄭之辱。

translations.literal: Requested territory Zhao, Zhao not gave, because besieging Zheng humiliation.
translations.idiomatic: He requested territory from Zhao, but Zhao did not give it, because of the humiliation of besieging Zheng.

sentences.zh: 知伯怒，遂率韓、魏攻趙。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo angry, then led Han, Wei attacked Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo was angry, so he led Han and Wei to attack Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙襄子懼，乃奔保晉陽。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiang Zi feared, then fled defended Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Xiang Zi was afraid, so he fled to defend Jin Yang.

sentences.zh: 原過從，後，至於王澤，見三人，自帶以上可見，自帶以下不可見。

translations.literal: Yuan Guo followed, afterward, arrived at Wang Ze, saw three persons, from belt above visible, from belt below invisible.
translations.idiomatic: Yuan Guo followed, and afterward, when he arrived at Wang Ze, he saw three persons. From the belt upward they were visible, but from the belt downward they were invisible.

sentences.zh: 與原過竹二節，莫通。

translations.literal: Gave Yuan Guo bamboo two joints, not opened.
translations.idiomatic: They gave Yuan Guo two joints of bamboo that could not be opened.

sentences.zh: 曰：「為我以是遺趙毋卹。」

translations.literal: Said: 'For me with this send Zhao Wu Xu.'
translations.idiomatic: They said: 'Deliver this to Zhao Wu Xu for us.'

sentences.zh: 原過既至，以告襄子。

translations.literal: Yuan Guo already arrived, with told Xiang Zi.
translations.idiomatic: After Yuan Guo arrived, he told Xiang Zi about it.

sentences.zh: 襄子齊三日，親自剖竹，有朱書曰：「趙毋卹，余霍泰山山陽侯天使也。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi purified three days, personally split bamboo, had vermilion writing said: 'Zhao Wu Xu, I Huo Tai Shan Shan Yang Hou heavenly envoy also.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi purified himself for three days, then personally split the bamboo. There was vermilion writing that said: 'Zhao Wu Xu, I am the heavenly envoy of Shan Yang Hou of Mount Huo Tai.

sentences.zh: 三月丙戌，余將使女反滅知氏。

translations.literal: Third month Bing Xu, I will make you counter extinguish Zhi clan.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bing Xu day of the third month, I will make you counterattack and destroy the Zhi clan.

sentences.zh: 女亦立我百邑，余將賜女林胡之地。

translations.literal: You also establish me hundred cities, I will grant you Lin Hu territory.
translations.idiomatic: You must also establish one hundred cities for me, and I will grant you the territory of Lin Hu.

sentences.zh: 至于後世，且有伉王，赤黑，龍面而鳥噣，鬢麋髭髯，大膺大胸，修下而馮，左袵界乘，奄有河宗，至于休溷諸貉，南伐晉別，北滅黑姑。」

translations.literal: Reach later generations, moreover will have strong king, red black, dragon face and bird beak, temple deer beard whiskers, big breast big chest, long below and bent, left lapel boundary ride, suddenly have river ancestor, reach Xiu Zhuo various barbarian, south attack Jin branch, north extinguish black aunt.'
translations.idiomatic: In later generations, there will be a strong king, red and black in color, with a dragon face and bird beak, with deer-like temples, beard, and whiskers, with a large breast and large chest, long below and bent, wearing a left lapel and riding at the boundary. He will suddenly possess the River Ancestor, reaching to Xiu Zhuo and the various barbarians, attacking the Jin branch in the south and extinguishing Heigu in the north.'

sentences.zh: 襄子再拜，受三神之令。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi bowed twice, received three spirits command.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi bowed twice and received the command of the three spirits.

sentences.zh: 三國攻晉陽，歲餘，引汾水灌其城，城不浸者三版。

translations.literal: Three states attacked Jin Yang, year remaining, led Fen water flooded its city, city not soaked three boards.
translations.idiomatic: The three states attacked Jin Yang for over a year. They diverted the Fen River to flood the city, and only three boards' height of the city wall remained unsoaked.

sentences.zh: 城中懸釜而炊，易子而食。

translations.literal: City in suspended cauldron and cooked, exchanged children and ate.
translations.idiomatic: In the city, they suspended cauldrons to cook and exchanged children to eat.

sentences.zh: 群臣皆有外心，禮益慢，唯高共不敢失禮。

translations.literal: Various ministers all had outer hearts, ritual increasingly slow, only Gao Gong not dared lose ritual.
translations.idiomatic: All the various ministers had disloyal hearts, and ritual became increasingly lax. Only Gao Gong did not dare to lose proper ritual.

sentences.zh: 襄子懼，乃夜使相張孟同私於韓、魏。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi feared, then night sent prime minister Zhang Meng Tong secretly to Han, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi was afraid, so at night he sent his prime minister Zhang Meng Tong to secretly meet with the rulers of Han and Wei.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏與合謀，以三月丙戌，三國反滅知氏，共分其地。

translations.literal: Han, Wei with united plotted, with third month Bing Xu, three states counter extinguished Zhi clan, together divided its territory.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei joined in the plot, and on the Bing Xu day of the third month, the three states counterattacked and destroyed the Zhi clan, dividing its territory together.

sentences.zh: 於是襄子行賞，高共為上。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Zi carried out rewards, Gao Gong as highest.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Xiang Zi distributed rewards, and Gao Gong was ranked highest.

sentences.zh: 張孟同曰：「晉陽之難，唯共無功。」

translations.literal: Zhang Meng Tong said: 'Jin Yang difficulty, only Gong no merit.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Meng Tong said: 'During the difficulty at Jin Yang, only Gong had no merit.'

sentences.zh: 襄子曰：「方晉陽急，群臣皆懈，惟共不敢失人臣禮，是以先之。」

translations.literal: Xiang Zi said: 'When Jin Yang urgent, various ministers all lax, only Gong not dared lose minister ritual, this is why first him.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi said: 'When Jin Yang was in urgent danger, all the various ministers were lax. Only Gong did not dare to lose the ritual proper to a minister. This is why I rank him first.'

sentences.zh: 於是趙北有代，南并知氏，彊於韓、魏。

translations.literal: Thereupon Zhao north had Dai, south annexed Zhi clan, strong over Han, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Zhao possessed Dai in the north and annexed the Zhi clan in the south, becoming stronger than Han and Wei.

sentences.zh: 遂祠三神於百邑，使原過主霍泰山祠祀。

translations.literal: Then sacrificed to three spirits at hundred cities, sent Yuan Guo presided Huo Tai Shan sacrificial rites.
translations.idiomatic: Then he established sacrifices to the three spirits at one hundred cities and sent Yuan Guo to preside over the sacrificial rites at Mount Huo Tai.

sentences.zh: 其後娶空同氏，生五子。

translations.literal: His later married Kong Tong clan, begat five sons.
translations.idiomatic: Later he married a woman from the Kong Tong clan and begat five sons.

sentences.zh: 襄子為伯魯之不立也，不肯立子，且必欲傳位與伯魯子代成君。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi because Bo Lu not established, not willing establish son, moreover must wished transmit position to Bo Lu son Dai Cheng Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Because Bo Lu was not established, Xiang Zi was unwilling to establish his own son. Moreover, he was determined to transmit the position to Bo Lu's son, Dai Cheng Jun.

sentences.zh: 成君先死，乃取代成君子浣立為太子。

translations.literal: Cheng Jun first died, then took Dai Cheng Jun son Huan established as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Jun died first, so he took Dai Cheng Jun's son Huan and established him as the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 襄子立三十三年卒，浣立，是為獻侯。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi established thirty-three years died, Huan established, this was Xian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi was established for thirty-three years and then died. Huan was established and became the Xian Hou.

sentences.zh: 獻侯少即位，治中牟。

translations.literal: Xian Hou young ascended throne, governed Zhong Mou.
translations.idiomatic: Xian Hou ascended the throne while young and governed Zhong Mou.

sentences.zh: 襄子弟桓子逐獻侯，自立於代，一年卒。

translations.literal: Xiang Zi younger brother Jian Zi expelled Xian Hou, self-established at Dai, one year died.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zi's younger brother Jian Zi expelled the Xian Hou, established himself at Dai, and died after one year.

sentences.zh: 國人曰桓子立非襄子意，乃共殺其子而復迎立獻侯。

translations.literal: State people said Jian Zi establishment not Xiang Zi intent, then together killed his son and again welcomed established Xian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The people of the state said that Jian Zi's establishment was not Xiang Zi's intent, so they together killed his son and again welcomed and established the Xian Hou.

sentences.zh: 十年，中山武公初立。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Zhong Shan Wu Gong first established.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Wu of Zhong Shan was first established.

sentences.zh: 十三年，城平邑。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, walled Ping Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, they walled Ping Yi.

sentences.zh: 十五年，獻侯卒，子烈侯籍立。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Xian Hou died, son Lie Hou Ji established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, the Xian Hou died, and his son Lie Hou Ji was established.

sentences.zh: 烈侯元年，魏文侯伐中山，使太子擊守之。

translations.literal: Lie Hou first year, Wei Wen Hou attacked Zhong Shan, sent crown prince Ji guarded it.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Lie Hou, Duke Wen of Wei attacked Zhong Shan and sent Crown Prince Ji to guard it.

sentences.zh: 六年，魏、韓、趙皆相立為諸侯，追尊獻子為獻侯。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Wei, Han, Zhao all mutually established as feudal lords, posthumously honored Xian Zi as Xian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Wei, Han, and Zhao all mutually established themselves as feudal lords and posthumously honored Xian Zi as the Xian Hou.

sentences.zh: 烈侯好音，謂相國公仲連曰：「寡人有愛，可以貴之乎？」

translations.literal: Lie Hou liked music, told prime minister Gong Zhong Lian said: 'I have love, can ennoble it huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Lie Hou liked music and said to his prime minister Gong Zhong Lian: 'I have someone I love. Can I grant the person a noble rank?'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「富之可，貴之則否。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Enrich him can, ennoble him then no.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said: 'You can enrich him, but you cannot ennoble him.'

sentences.zh: 烈侯曰：「然。

translations.literal: Lie Hou said: 'Yes.
translations.idiomatic: Lie Hou said: 'Yes.

sentences.zh: 夫鄭歌者槍、石二人，吾賜之田，人萬畝。」

translations.literal: Indeed Zheng singers Qiang, Shi two persons, I grant them fields, each ten thousand mu.'
translations.idiomatic: The two Zheng singers Qiang and Shi, I will grant them fields, ten thousand mu each.'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 不與。

translations.literal: Not gave.
translations.idiomatic: He did not give it.

sentences.zh: 居一月，烈侯從代來，問歌者田。

translations.literal: Resided one month, Lie Hou from Dai came, asked singers fields.
translations.idiomatic: After residing for one month, Lie Hou came from Dai and asked about the singers' fields.

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「求，未有可者。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Sought, not yet had suitable ones.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said: 'I have sought, but have not yet found suitable ones.'

sentences.zh: 有頃，烈侯復問。

translations.literal: After a while, Lie Hou again asked.
translations.idiomatic: After a while, Lie Hou asked again.

sentences.zh: 公仲終不與，乃稱疾不朝。

translations.literal: Gong Zhong in end not gave, then claimed illness not court.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong in the end did not give it, so he claimed illness and did not attend court.

sentences.zh: 番吾君自代來，謂公仲曰：「君實好善，而未知所持。

translations.literal: Fan Wu jun from Dai came, told Gong Zhong said: 'Lord indeed likes good, but not knows what to hold.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Fan Wu came from Dai and said to Gong Zhong: 'You indeed like goodness, but you do not know what to hold to.

sentences.zh: 今公仲相趙，於今四年，亦有進士乎？」

translations.literal: Now Gong Zhong prime ministers Zhao, to now four years, also has advanced scholars huh?'
translations.idiomatic: Now Gong Zhong has been the prime minister of Zhao for four years. Have you also advanced any scholars?'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「未也。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Not yet.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said: 'Not yet.'

sentences.zh: 番吾君曰：「牛畜、荀欣、徐越皆可。」

translations.literal: Fan Wu jun said: 'Niu Xu, Xun Xin, Xu Yue all can.'
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Fan Wu said: 'Niu Xu, Xun Xin, and Xu Yue are all suitable.'

sentences.zh: 公仲乃進三人。

translations.literal: Gong Zhong then advanced three persons.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong then advanced the three men.

sentences.zh: 及朝，烈侯復問：「歌者田何如？」

translations.literal: Reached court, Lie Hou again asked: 'Singers fields what like?'
translations.idiomatic: When they reached court, Lie Hou asked again: 'What about the singers' fields?'

sentences.zh: 公仲曰：「方使擇其善者。」

translations.literal: Gong Zhong said: 'Just sent to select their good ones.'
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhong said: 'I have just sent someone to select the good ones.'

sentences.zh: 牛畜侍烈侯以仁義，約以王道，烈侯逌然。

translations.literal: Niu Xu served Lie Hou with benevolence righteousness, constrained with kingly way, Lie Hou enlightened.
translations.idiomatic: Niu Xu served Lie Hou with benevolence and righteousness, constraining him with the kingly way. Lie Hou was enlightened.

sentences.zh: 明日，荀欣侍，以選練舉賢，任官使能。

translations.literal: Next day, Xun Xin served, with selecting training raising worthy, appointing officials employing able.
translations.idiomatic: The next day, Xun Xin served, speaking of selecting and training, raising the worthy, and appointing officials to employ the able.

sentences.zh: 明日，徐越侍，以節財儉用，察度功德。

translations.literal: Next day, Xu Yue served, with regulating wealth frugal use, examining measuring merit virtue.
translations.idiomatic: The next day, Xu Yue served, speaking of regulating wealth and frugal use, and examining and measuring merit and virtue.

sentences.zh: 所與無不充，君說。

translations.literal: What given nothing not full, lord pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Everything that was given was fully provided, and the lord was pleased.

sentences.zh: 烈侯使使謂相國曰：「歌者之田且止。」

translations.literal: Lie Hou sent messenger told prime minister said: 'Singers fields moreover stop.'
translations.idiomatic: Lie Hou sent a messenger to tell the prime minister: 'Stop the matter of the singers' fields.'

sentences.zh: 官牛畜為師，荀欣為中尉，徐越為內史，賜相國衣二襲。

translations.literal: Appointed Niu Xu as teacher, Xun Xin as central captain, Xu Yue as inner scribe, granted prime minister clothes two sets.
translations.idiomatic: He appointed Niu Xu as teacher, Xun Xin as central captain, and Xu Yue as inner scribe, and granted the prime minister two sets of clothes.

sentences.zh: 九年，烈侯卒，弟武公立。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Lie Hou died, younger brother Wu Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Lie Hou died, and his younger brother Wu Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 武公十三年卒，趙復立烈侯太子章，是為敬侯。

translations.literal: Wu Gong thirteenth year died, Zhao again established Lie Hou crown prince Zhang, this was Jing Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Wu Gong died, and Zhao again established Lie Hou's crown prince Zhang, who became Jing Hou.

sentences.zh: 是歲，魏文侯卒。

translations.literal: This year, Wei Wen Hou died.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Duke Wen of Wei died.

sentences.zh: 敬侯元年，武公子朝作亂，不克，出奔魏。

translations.literal: Jing Hou first year, Wu Gong son Zi Chao made rebellion, not conquer, out fled Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Jing Hou, Wu Gong's son Zi Chao made a rebellion, but did not succeed, and fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 趙始都邯鄲。

translations.literal: Zhao began capital Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao first made Handan its capital.

sentences.zh: 二年，敗齊于靈丘。

translations.literal: Second year, defeated Qi at Ling Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, he defeated Qi at Ling Qiu.

sentences.zh: 三年，救魏于廩丘，大敗齊人。

translations.literal: Third year, rescued Wei at Dian Qiu, greatly defeated Qi people.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, he rescued Wei at Dian Qiu and greatly defeated the people of Qi.

sentences.zh: 四年，魏敗我兔臺。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Wei defeated us Tu Tai.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Wei defeated us at Tu Tai.

sentences.zh: 筑剛平以侵衛。

translations.literal: Built Gang Ping to invade Wei.
translations.idiomatic: He built Gang Ping to invade Wei.

sentences.zh: 五年，齊、魏為衛攻趙，取我剛平。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Qi, Wei for Wei attacked Zhao, took our Gang Ping.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qi and Wei attacked Zhao on behalf of Wei and took our Gang Ping.

sentences.zh: 六年，借兵於楚伐魏，取棘蒲。

translations.literal: Sixth year, borrowed troops from Chu attacked Wei, took Ji Pu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, he borrowed troops from Chu to attack Wei and took Ji Pu.

sentences.zh: 八年，拔魏黃城。

translations.literal: Eighth year, captured Wei Huang Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he captured Wei's Huang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 九年，伐齊。

translations.literal: Ninth year, attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, he attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊伐燕，趙救燕。

translations.literal: Qi attacked Yan, Zhao rescued Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Qi attacked Yan, and Zhao rescued Yan.

sentences.zh: 十年，與中山戰于房子。

translations.literal: Tenth year, with Zhong Shan battled at Fang Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, he battled with Zhong Shan at Fang Zi.

sentences.zh: 十一年，魏、韓、趙共滅晉，分其地。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Wei, Han, Zhao together extinguished Jin, divided its territory.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Wei, Han, and Zhao together extinguished Jin and divided its territory.

sentences.zh: 伐中山，又戰於中人。

translations.literal: Attacked Zhong Shan, again battled at Zhong Ren.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Zhong Shan and again battled at Zhong Ren.

sentences.zh: 十二年，敬侯卒，子成侯種立。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Jing Hou died, son Cheng Hou Zhong established.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Jing Hou died, and his son Cheng Hou Zhong was established.

sentences.zh: 成侯元年，公子勝與成侯爭立，為亂。

translations.literal: Cheng Hou first year, Gong Zi Sheng with Cheng Hou contended establishment, made rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Cheng Hou, Prince Sheng contended with Cheng Hou for establishment and made a rebellion.

sentences.zh: 二年六月，雨雪。

translations.literal: Second year sixth month, rained snow.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of the second year, it snowed.

sentences.zh: 三年，太戊午為相。

translations.literal: Third year, Tai Wu Wu became prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Tai Wu Wu became prime minister.

sentences.zh: 伐衛，取鄉邑七十三。

translations.literal: Attacked Wei, took district cities seventy-three.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Wei and took seventy-three district cities.

sentences.zh: 魏敗我藺。

translations.literal: Wei defeated us Lin.
translations.idiomatic: Wei defeated us at Lin.

sentences.zh: 四年，與秦戰高安，敗之。

translations.literal: Fourth year, with Qin battled Gao An, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, he battled with Qin at Gao An and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐齊于鄄。

translations.literal: Fifth year, attacked Qi at Juan.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, he attacked Qi at Juan.

sentences.zh: 魏敗我懷。

translations.literal: Wei defeated us Huai.
translations.idiomatic: Wei defeated us at Huai.

sentences.zh: 攻鄭，敗之，以與韓，韓與我長子。

translations.literal: Attacked Zheng, defeated it, with gave to Han, Han gave me eldest son.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Zheng and defeated it, then gave it to Han. Han gave me the city of Changzi.

sentences.zh: 六年，中山筑長城。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Zhong Shan built long wall.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Zhong Shan built a long wall.

sentences.zh: 伐魏，敗湪澤，圍魏惠王。

translations.literal: Attacked Wei, defeated at Tuo Ze, besieged Wei Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Wei, defeated them at Tuo Ze, and besieged King Hui of Wei.

translations.literal: The king said: 'Former kings had different customs, what ancient laws exist?'

translations.literal: Emperors and kings do not imitate each other, what rituals should be followed?

sentences.zh: 虙戲、神農教而不誅，黃帝、堯、舜誅而不怒。

translations.literal: Fuxi and Shennong taught without punishing, Yellow Emperor, Yao, and Shun punished without anger.

sentences.zh: 及至三王，隨時制法，因事制禮。

translations.literal: When it came to the Three Kings, they made laws according to the times, created rituals according to circumstances.

sentences.zh: 法度制令各順其宜，衣服器械各便其用。

translations.literal: Laws, measures, decrees, and commands each followed what was appropriate, clothing and implements each suited their use.

sentences.zh: 故禮也不必一道，而便國不必古。

translations.literal: Therefore, ritual does not necessarily follow one path, and what benefits the state does not necessarily come from antiquity.

sentences.zh: 聖人之興也不相襲而王，夏、殷之衰也不易禮而滅。

translations.literal: The rise of sages does not imitate predecessors to become kings, the decline of Xia and Yin did not change rituals to perish.

sentences.zh: 然則反古未可非，而循禮未足多也。

translations.literal: Thus, returning to antiquity cannot be criticized, but following ritual is not sufficient praise.

sentences.zh: 且服奇者志淫，則是鄒、魯無奇行也；

translations.literal: Moreover, those who wear strange clothing have licentious ambitions, but this means that Zou and Lu have no exceptional conduct;

sentences.zh: 俗辟者民易，則是吳、越無秀士也。

translations.literal: Customs that are eccentric make the people fickle, but this means that Wu and Yue have no outstanding scholars.

sentences.zh: 且聖人利身謂之服，便事謂之禮。

translations.literal: Moreover, the sages called benefiting the body 'clothing', and what facilitates affairs 'ritual'.

sentences.zh: 夫進退之節，衣服之制者，所以齊常民也，非所以論賢者也。

translations.literal: Indeed, the regulations for advancing and retreating, the systems for clothing, these are to regulate the common people, not to judge the worthy.

sentences.zh: 故齊民與俗流，賢者與變俱。

translations.literal: Therefore, regulate the people to flow with customs, the worthy accompany changes.

sentences.zh: 故諺曰『以書御者不盡馬之情，以古制今者不達事之變』。

translations.literal: Therefore the proverb says: 'One who drives a horse by the book does not understand the horse's temperament, one who applies ancient systems to today does not comprehend changes in affairs.'

sentences.zh: 循法之功，不足以高世；

translations.literal: The merit of following the law is not sufficient to stand above the world;

sentences.zh: 法古之學，不足以制今。

translations.literal: Studying the laws of antiquity is not sufficient to govern the present.
